title: Verify Opus 4.5 difficulty scale calibration
description: Review the difficulty scale in .claude/reference/shared-definitions.md and task-schema-consolidated.md. Verify that breakpoints (7+ = must breakdown, 9-10 = multi-phase) are appropriate for Opus 4.5 capabilities. Adjust if needed based on observed task execution patterns.
completion_notes: Difficulty scale verified as well-calibrated for Opus 4.5. Current breakpoints: 1-2 (routine, just do it), 3-4 (standard, may take multiple steps), 5-6 (substantial, design decisions needed), 7-8 (MUST break down), 9-10 (MUST break into phases). Evidence: Tasks 1_1-1_4 (difficulty 3-6) completed successfully without breakdown. Task 1 (difficulty 7) correctly decomposed into 4 subtasks. Extended thinking triggers align: difficulty 7-8 → 'think harder', 9-10 → 'ultrathink'. The 'one focused session' heuristic effectively determines the 6/7 boundary. No changes needed - scale appropriately balances Opus 4.5's enhanced reasoning with practical decomposition needs.
notes: Validation was read-only. The difficulty scale and extended thinking triggers are in sync and production-ready.

assumptions.description: Current breakpoints are reasonable starting points
Opus 4.5 may handle higher difficulty than previous versions

decision_rationale: Verified calibration by: (1) Reviewing all shared-definitions.md files across root, lite/, and standard/; (2) Cross-referencing task-schema-consolidated.md difficulty descriptions; (3) Checking extended-thinking-triggers.md for alignment; (4) Validating against actual task completion patterns (tasks 1, 1_1-1_4). Opus 4.5's enhanced reasoning justifies keeping difficulty 5-6 as 'just do it with steps' while the 7+ breakdown threshold remains appropriate for context-heavy multi-file work.
